Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The process always begins with the 'Receive order' activity. After an order is received, the next logical step is to check whether the inventory is sufficient to fulfill it. This 'Check inventory' step must occur before any decisions about payment authorization or fulfillment are made.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: If there's enough inventory, the order should go through 'Authorize payment,' then 'Package items,' then 'Ship order,' and end with 'Close order.' If there's not enough inventory, the process must branch into 'Cancel order' and then 'Close order.'

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 1 starts with Receive order, then Check inventory, Authorize payment, Package items, Ship order, and Close order. This matches the normative process, so no violation here.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 2: Same sequence as Case 1. It's also following the norm, so no issues.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Case 3: Receive order, Check inventory, Authorize payment, Cancel order, Ship order, Close order.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After Authorize payment, the next step should be Package items, not Cancel. According to the norm, this case violates because it cancels before Package items.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Case 4: Receive order, Check inventory, Cancel order.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After Check inventory, it should proceed to Package items, not Cancel. Therefore, this case violates the norm. The process skipped the rest of the required steps.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Case 5: Receive order, Check inventory, Authorize payment, Ship order, Close order.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: After Authorize payment, the next step should be Package items. Instead, the process skips Package and goes to Ship order. Hence, this case violates the norm.
